members.forms module

class members.forms.RegisterUserForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: UserCreationForm

Extends the built-in UserCreationForm to add an email field and customize the appearance of form fields using Bootstrap CSS classes.

Fields:

  • ‘email’: An EmailField for user’s email address.

  • ‘first_name’: A CharField for user’s first name.

  • ‘last_name’: A CharField for user’s last name.

Meta class:

  • ‘model’: Specifies the User model to be used.

  • ‘fields’: Defines the fields to be included in the form.

__init__ method:

  • Customizes the appearance of all form fields by adding the ‘form-control’ class to their widgets.

members.urls module

members.views module

members.views.login_user(request)[source]

Handles user login.

Parameters:

object (A Django HTTP response) – On successful login: Redirects to a success page (home page) with a success message in the context. On invalid login: Renders the login form again with an error message in the context.

Returns:

Redirects to the home page with a success message.

members.views.logout_confirmation(request)[source]

Handles user logout.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Redirects to the home page with a success message.

members.views.logout_user(request)[source]

Handles user logout.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Redirects to the home page with a success message.

members.views.register_user(request)[source]

Registers a new user and logs them in on successful registration.

Parameters:

request – request object containing user-submitted data.

Returns:

A redirect response to the user profile page on successful registration and login. A rendered registration form template on GET request or failed form validation.

Raises:

ValueError – If required form fields are missing or invalid.
